title: How to Add a Cute Bow to a Plain T Shirt

steps.headline: Choose a plain t-shirt.
steps.description: It doesn't matter what color although choose a color you like personally. Use one that's a size/half a size up of your normal size, if you're going to do belting, or tying in the back.

steps.headline: Find a good pair of fabric scissors.
Turn the t-shirt inside out.
steps.description: Then lay it flat on the ground/table and line the seams up.

steps.headline: Create a V-neck if needed and wanted.
steps.description:
Mark dots where you want the V-neck to be. Once you've measured up the neck, start cutting in the V formation. Hem stitch to prevent fraying after cutting. Make sure there's no mistakes with the neckline. Adjust if needed. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1d\/Create-Your-Own-T-Shirt-Step-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Create-Your-Own-T-Shirt-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1d\/Create-Your-Own-T-Shirt-Step-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Create-Your-Own-T-Shirt-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

parts.name: Adding the bow to the t-shirt

steps.headline: Make the holes for the bow.
steps.description: Flip the t-shirt over, and mark two dots in the middle of the t-shirt. Make these around an inch or two (2.5-5cm) apart. Then cut small holes where the dots were.

steps.headline: Find a shoelace, ribbon or any other kind of tie.
steps.description: Loop it through the two holes. Do this by sticking one end of the tie under the t-shirt, and pulling it through the hole, outwards. Then do the same with the other.

steps.headline: Tie the two ends in a bow.
steps.description: If you'd rather a knot or a more fancy bow, tie as required (you may need to follow a bow-tying tutorial for fancier bows).

steps.headline: Done.
steps.description: Try the t-shirt on and check the effect in the mirror.

steps.headline: If wished, add any other effects or decorations that incorporate the bow or enhance it.
steps.description: For example, use fabric paint to draw the image of a person who is wearing the bow, as shown in this image. You could also add writing, more ties, etc., as your creativity inspires you to do.

steps.headline: Draw in the t-shirt if needed.
steps.description: You could stitch it to make it fitted or draw it in at the back with a back tie, as wished.

text:
Preparing the t-shirt Choose a plain t-shirt. It doesn't matter what color although choose a color you like personally. Use one that's a size/half a size up of your normal size, if you're going to do belting, or tying in the back. Find a good pair of fabric scissors. Turn the t-shirt inside out. Then lay it flat on the ground/table and line the seams up. Create a V-neck if needed and wanted. Mark dots where you want the V-neck to be. Once you've measured up the neck, start cutting in the V formation. Hem stitch to prevent fraying after cutting. Make sure there's no mistakes with the neckline. Adjust if needed. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1d\/Create-Your-Own-T-Shirt-Step-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Create-Your-Own-T-Shirt-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1d\/Create-Your-Own-T-Shirt-Step-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Create-Your-Own-T-Shirt-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Adding the bow to the t-shirt Make the holes for the bow. Flip the t-shirt over, and mark two dots in the middle of the t-shirt. Make these around an inch or two (2.5-5cm) apart. Then cut small holes where the dots were. Find a shoelace, ribbon or any other kind of tie. Loop it through the two holes. Do this by sticking one end of the tie under the t-shirt, and pulling it through the hole, outwards. Then do the same with the other. Tie the two ends in a bow. If you'd rather a knot or a more fancy bow, tie as required (you may need to follow a bow-tying tutorial for fancier bows). Done. Try the t-shirt on and check the effect in the mirror. Adding a design (optional) If wished, add any other effects or decorations that incorporate the bow or enhance it. For example, use fabric paint to draw the image of a person who is wearing the bow, as shown in this image. You could also add writing, more ties, etc., as your creativity inspires you to do. Draw in the t-shirt if needed. You could stitch it to make it fitted or draw it in at the back with a back tie, as wished.
